newsitem.title: EGYPT: State sells shares in Nile Ginning.
newsitem.headline: State sells shares in Nile Ginning.

text.p: The Egyptian state sold more than 1.35 million shares in Nile Cotton Ginning to strategic investors on Thursday at between 42.50 and 50.00 pounds a share.
The state's Holding Company for Cotton and International Trading had offered at least 1.2 million shares, 20 percent of the company, at a minimum price of 42.00 pounds.
Data from the Egyptian stock exchange showed that in the first hour of trading on Thursday, 1.37 million shares were sold in 38 transactions for 61.11 million pounds ($18 million).
The holding company and the agents for the sale were not available to say if the state planned to sell more.
Nile Cotton Ginning almost doubled net after-tax profits for the 1995/6 financial year to 14.089 million pounds ($4.14 million) from 7.187 million in the previous year.
The average sale price of about 44.60 pounds a share gives a P/E ratio of about 19, higher than average for the Cairo market.
